body_html: Aaaand the increasing number of tensors you can see from Python is a copy of weights and workspace that is maintained by cuDNN RNN autograd functions. Autograd RNNs don't have the same problem (even if they save tensors, they're not visible for Python's GC).
body_text: Aaaand the increasing number of tensors you can see from Python is a copy of weights and workspace that is maintained by cuDNN RNN autograd functions. Autograd RNNs don't have the same problem (even if they save tensors, they're not visible for Python's GC).
body: Aaaand the increasing number of tensors you can see from Python is a copy of weights and workspace that is maintained by cuDNN RNN autograd functions. Autograd RNNs don't have the same problem (even if they save tensors, they're not visible for Python's GC).
